After 1,000+ hours across Civ IV - VI, I can happily say that IV is the best in the series. The AI is brutal even on normal difficulties and can't be walked over easily like in V and VI. The tech tree is also the best in my opinion and the different traits and starting technologies for each leader/civilization provide a surprising amount of variety.

Buying Civ IV at a book fair at my middle school in 2006 may be one of the best decision I ever made.

THE most replayable game of all time. I suppose you could say that about any Civilization game, however, Civ IV is arguably the most balanced offering in the series. It is my preference down to this day, in 2025, after 30 years of playing the series

The best Civ game by far. And I have been playing since Civ 1.

I have spent many thousands of hours on this over the years. The newer games don't even come close.

This is the type of game where you can lose hours of your life and have zero regrets about it. If strategy is your thing but you don't want it to be too complex like a grand strategy game then this is the perfect game to play.
Still the best civ game. Way better than civ 7 for sure, lol. Ai does best in this civ, any civ after this the AI sucks, it can't handle hexes and other logic.

This is my favorite of the games of the Civilization series. I played this game for hours at a time long before I ever had a Steam account, and it's still as fun to play now as it was back then. I recommend it to anyone who wants to try an older Civilization game.

this is the final update for civilization 4 and the best version of the civilization in the franchise, for many reasons. The 2000's graphics are acceptable, earlier civ games have interesting and great mechanics but the graphics are just to archaic. The consensus is that the later versions of civ were simplified to give it a wider audience and that is great because the game is still releasing to this day, but civ 4 seams more realistic and really gives you a feeling that you have lived through world history. Even though the AI is older, the characters  seem more real in civ 4. I also always prefer the grid lay out over the tiles. I know the grid can be exploited as in you can travel further in a diagonal line but the grid just seams more intuitive and satisfying. Combat also seems more realistic. I also prefer the religious and cultural mechanics in civ 4. But really all of the civ games are worth playing and they all play different. Civ 3 is also great as are civ 1 and 2 though i can not take the graphics past 3.

If we're talking vanilla/unmodded, the series peaked with Civilization IV: Beyond the Sword. Having played all the Civ games except VII, BtS is still my go to whenever I want to play a game of Civilization.
